description:
A small key you found in the Ancient Cave. It looks
like it'll fall apart any minute, but somehow it doesn't.
name: Ancient Key

description:
It's just a leek? Get enough of these, and you
might find that looking was worth your while...
name: Leek

description: A simple yellow flower. It's very common.
name: Yellow Flower

description:
A red flower. It's slightly less common than
yellow flowers, but not by much.
name: Red Flower

description:
A blue herb. It's somewhat rare, in
comparison to other plants.
name: Blue Herb

description:
A small package you need to bring to the
Village Headman. What could be inside...
name: Small Package

description:
An old key that the Village Headman asked
you to find. It's oddly shaped.
name: Old Key

description:
A bottle of clean water. It has quite a few uses,
its main one being recovering a small amount of HP.
name: Water Bottle

description:
A small potion. It has an invigorating taste.
If only they were cheaper...
name: Small Potion

description:
A map of Adon. It should help guide you all
the way down the continent.
name: Map of Adon

description:
An empty book given to you by the Village Headman.
The pages are blank - try to fill 'em up!
name: Quest Log

description:
A sticky vial of gel you collected from a Green
Slime
name: Green Gel

description:
Some loot that the Banditos pilfered from the
citizens of somewhere. It'd be best to return it.
name: Bandito Loot

description:
An MP-healing variant of the Small Potion. It
sparkles slightly. Is there a still version?
name: Small Elixir

description:
A key to Room 1 of the Verdin Village inn.
It's a literal key item.
name: Room 1 Key

description:
A ration of food. It smells delicious, and will
surely taste delicious... mmm!
name: Ration

description:
A magic bag made by Matilda. It allows all
your team members to access the same inventory.
name: Void Bag

description:
It's a tent. There's nothing too special about it.
It does fold nicely into a little container, though.
name: Tent

description:
An even tastier ration. It smells more delicious than
ever, and will surely taste incredible... mmm!
name: Fulfilling Ration

description:
A bottle of gel you collected from a Blue Slime. It
looks like water... why not give it a taste?
name: Blue Gel

description:
A ration of rat jerky. It doesn't look too tasty...
it should be nutritious though, right?
name: Ration (Rat Jerky)

description:
It's some fur from a Giant Rat. Gross! It can't
make anything useful, so you might as well sell it.
name: Rat Fur

description:
A dusty old book. When read, your EXP from
battles will get a boost. Lasts 800 steps.
name: Tome of Experience

description:
An old bit of Kevin's cape that tore off
in your battle with him.
name: Kevin's Cape Scrap

description:
An annoyingly hard-to-handle key. All it
opens is the cells in the Bandito Hideout.
name: Cell Key

description:
A strange badge you found in Four-Toed Kevin's
room. It glimmers with an otherworldly light.
name: Mysterious Badge

description:
A smooth cherry-flavored drink that boosts your
MHP by 15%. Lasts for 10 turns or 500 steps.
name: Vital Cola

description:
A fizzy blueberry-flavored drink that boosts your
MMP by 15%. Lasts for 10 turns or 500 steps.
name: Mana Fizz

description:
A viscous almond-flavored drink that boosts your
DEF by 15%. Lasts for 10 turns or 500 steps.
name: Rocky Sip

description:
A spicy grape-flavored drink that boosts your
MAT by 15%. Lasts for 10 turns or 500 steps.
name: Arcanic Chug

description:
Some cool looking dust that Bob and James found.
It might be gold!... but it's probably just sand.
name: Cool Dust

description:
If you do the math, this is better than buying
\ii[9]\c[0]s. So buy these up! Or use skills.
name: Potion

description:
It's even sparklier than the \ii[14]. You'd
better like the fizz, 'cause there's a lot.
name: Elixir

description:
Recovers a ton of HP and MP. You'd better not be
full just yet - there's a lotta' juice in here.
name: Recovery Vat

description: Boosts the ATK of a weapon or accessory by +2.
name: ATK Scroll
note:
<Upgrade Weapon Type: 0>
<Upgrade Effect>
ATK: +2
</Upgrade Effect>

<Menu Category: Upgraders>

description: Boosts the MAT of a weapon or accessory by +2.
name: MAT Scroll
note:
<Upgrade Weapon Type: 0>
<Upgrade Effect>
MAT: +2
</Upgrade Effect>

<Menu Category: Upgraders>

description: Ok, not gonna' lie, that's kinda' gross.
name: Skeleton Skull

description:
The bloody, beaten skull of Laeryidyean. Once belonging
to a very strong being, but now just a simple trophy.
name: Laeyridyean's Skull

description: A soul that you took from a tough monster.
name: Boss Soul (Mini-Boss)

description: A soul that you took from a very strong monster.
name: Boss Soul (Region Boss)

description:
A soul that you took from the
strongest monster in a dimension.
name: Boss Soul (Dimension Boss)

description:
A letter that Jack wrote. It allows
you access to the Mayor of Greenfield.
name: Letter of Recommendation

description:
A simple yet versatile crafting item. It can be
used to make a variety of different objects.
name: Wood
note:
<Menu Category: Materials>
<Sell Price: 2>

<Disassemble Pool: Axe>
x1-3 Bark: 100%
x1 Stick: 75%
</Disassemble Pool: Axe>

description:
A small bead of water surrounded by a crystalline
shell. Can be used to craft water-related items.
name: Aqua Gem

description:
A loaf of organic whole wheat bread.
Made with care and tastiness in mind.
name: Loaf of Bread

description:
A good ol' apple: as tasty and revitalizing as always.
You can probably make some apple-based foods with this.
name: Apple

description:
Some bark that you stripped off a piece of wood.
You can probably use it as kindling for a small fire.
name: Bark

description: Boosts the DEF of an armor or accessory by +3.
name: DEF Scroll
note:
<Upgrade Armor Type: 0>
<Upgrade Effect>
DEF: +2
</Upgrade Effect>

<Menu Category: Upgraders>

description: Boosts the MDF of an armor or accessory by +3.
name: MDF Scroll
note:
<Upgrade Armor Type: 0>
<Upgrade Effect>
MDF: +2
</Upgrade Effect>

<Menu Category: Upgraders>

description:
Allows basic disassembling of softer items, typically
clothing and food. Cannot work with metal items.
name: Basic Salvage Kit

description:
A piece of cloth salvaged from an well-worn piece
of clothing. Only somewhat useful when in bulk.
name: Worn Cloth

description:
A small feather appearing to have originated
from the plumage of a small bird.
name: Feather

description:
It's easily dyed and is used to make a variety of finer
clothing. Can be bought, crafted from wool, or salvaged.
name: Yarn

description:
Reverts all effects of previously upgrades to any weapon
or piece of equipment, freeing up all upgrade slots.
name: Cleansing Scroll
note:
<Upgrade Weapon Type: 0>
<Upgrade Armor Type: 0>
<Upgrade Effect>
Slots: x
Reset Full
</Upgrade Effect>

<Menu Category: Upgraders>

description:
A piece of a map of Telluria. It's cut off at the
point where it's no use to you without the rest.
name: Telluria Map Fragment

description: I got a rock.
name: Rock

description:
Slightly coarse, slightly smooth,
slightly tough, and a great material.
name: Leather

description:
An extremely large fang. Its tip
is sharp enough to cut rocks.
name: Giant Goblin's Fang

description:
A gritty chicken-flavored drink that boosts your
ATK by 15%. Lasts for 10 turns or 500 steps.
name: Brawl Brew

description:
A sparkly huckleberry-flavored drink that boosts your
MDF by 15%. Lasts for 10 turns or 500 steps.
name: Warding Swig

description:
A small purse filled with Bits and various items.
You retreived it from the Dandy Toads; now return it!
name: Peasant Woman's Purse

description:
A small bit of iron. The iron ore nodes which provide
these can be commonly found all over Telluria.
name: Iron Cluster

description:
Itemized version of the \ia[40].
Used exclusively for crafting.
name: ~Leather Boots

description:
Itemized version of the \iw[21].
Used exclusively for crafting.
name: ~Bronze Sword â˜…

description:
A small bit of copper. The copper ore nodes which
provide these can be frequently found all over Telluria.
name: Copper Cluster

description:
A small bit of bronze. It's forged by melting down
bronze and other materials, then combining them.
name: Bronze Alloy
note:
<Menu Category: Materials>
<Sell Price: 40>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Copper Cluster: 2
Gold: 30
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Orange-ish Alloy>

description:
An item necessary for carrying out especially difficult
forging procedures. It strengthens the power of the forge.
name: Forge Badge

description:
A combination of a few delicious foods.
The tastes compliment each other quite well.
name: Quick Snack
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery, Buffs, cook1>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Apple: 1
Carrot: 1
Loaf of Bread: 1
Gold: 25
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Tasty Food Combo>

description:
A combination of a \ii[9] and \ii[14].
It's smooth yet sparkly at the same time.
name: Small Ether
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery, cook1>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Small Potion: 1
Small Elixir: 1
Gold: 30
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Small Recovery Combo>

description:
A combination of a \ii[32] and \ii[33].
The recovery is great, as well as the contrasting flavors!
name: Ether
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery, cook1>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Potion: 1
Elixir: 1
Gold: 50
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Recovery Combo>

description:
A small bit of steel. It's forged by melting down
iron and other materials, then combining them.
name: Steel Alloy
note:
<Menu Category: Materials1>
<Sell Price: 40>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Iron Cluster: 2
Gold: 30
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Blue-ish Alloy>

description:
A base staff that can be used for crafting. Reinforcing,
enchanting, and all the like can be used on it.
name: Wooden Staff
note:
<Menu Category: Materials>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Wood: 3
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Staff for Crafting>

description:
Itemized version of \iw[18].
Used exclusively for crafting.
name: ~Bloodlust

description:
It's a fish. Good for slapping, but unsafe to be
consumed raw... you should cook something with it!
name: Fish

description:
An item necessary for carrying out especially difficult
enchanting procedures. It strengthens the power of magic.
name: Enchanting Badge

description:
It's just a stick, nothing too special. You can
probably use it for some crafting, though.
name: Stick

description:
A bottle filled and stained with red gel. It's too hot
for consumption, but it can be thrown to start a fire.
name: Red Gel
note:
<Menu Category: Drops>
<Remove State Category: Ice>
<Remove State Category: Water>

description:
The severed wing of a bat. It can be
sold or used as a material for crafting.
name: Bat Wing

description:
A useful kit that itemizes weapons and equipped, making
them unusable in battle but making them usable in crafting.
name: Itemization Kit

description:
The essence of hot creatures. Dropped by
fire-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Fire Essence

description:
The essence of cold creatures. Dropped by
ice-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Ice Essence

description:
The essence of conductive creatures. Dropped by
electric-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Electric Essence

description:
The essence of wet creatures. Dropped by
water-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Water Essence

description:
The essence of rocky creatures. Dropped by
earth-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Earth Essence

description:
The essence of airy creatures. Dropped by
wind-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Wind Essence

description:
The essence of holy creatures. Dropped by
light-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Light Essence

description:
The essence of evil creatures. Dropped by
dark-related enemies and used for crafting.
name: Dark Essence

description:
A skull frequently found in graveyards, placed by
those hoping to bring back a lost loved one.
name: Necrotic Skull
note:
<Menu Category: Materials>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Skeleton Skull: 1
Dark Essence: 3
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Symbolic Skull>

description:
Revives a party member with a sliver of HP. A real
one can only be plucked from the ashes of a phoenix.
name: Phoenix Feather Replica
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Feather: 1
Fire Essence: 3
Necrotic Skull: 1
Enchanting Badge: 1
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Revival Feather Replica>

description:
A juicy carrot! It restores a mediocre amount of HP, but
you can probably make better use of it through cooking.
name: Carrot

description:
A small egg taken from the nest of a bird. It's too
messy to eat out in the field, but it's great for cooking.
name: Egg

description:
A simple mushroom plucked from the ground. It restores
barely any HP raw, but it can make or break a recipe.
name: Brown Mushroom

description:
A bit of salt extracted from rocks in Bladesville and
put into a small container. Inedible in this form.
name: Salt

description:
A simple yet delicious omelet.
The flavor is immaculate!
name: Omelet
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery, Buffs>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Egg: 1
Brown Mushroom: 2
Salt: 1
Gold: 25
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Breakfast Dish>

description:
An ancient relic forged in the shifting sands of the
desert. Has the power to turn back time itself.
name: Archaic Hourglass

description:
An assortment of items that Will needs to keep the
forge going. You should get them back to him!
name: Will's Items

description:
A simple pickaxe required for mining ores. Its
imbalance makes it useless for combat, though.
name: Iron Pickaxe

description:
A simple arrow used as ammunition for bows. It's
not that strong, but it's cheap and effective.
name: Wooden Arrow

description:
A bullet used as basic gun ammunition. Its stronger
than an arrow, but it's more expensive to buy.
name: Iron Bullet

description:
Douse yourself in this disgusting fluid that will
make monsters leave you alone for 100 steps.
name: Acrid Aroma

description:
Douse yourself in this lovely liquid that will
attract twice as many monsterse to you for 100 steps.
name: Eau du Monstere

description:
A variation of mushroom that is extremely poisonous.
It's not something you want to ever eat!
name: Red Mushroom

description:
Some simple uncooked meat from an average-sized animal.
It's unsafe to eat raw, but it's great for cooking.
name: Raw Meat

description:
A simple dish made by cooking meat
and sprinkling some salt over it.
name: Salt-Grilled Meat
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery, Buffs>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Raw Meat: 1
Salt: 1
Gold: 15
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Preserved Food>

description:
A bundle of wheat grown in the Easin Plains. It's
inedible, but it's a versatile cooking ingredient.
name: Wheat

description:
A vial containing sugar harvested from cane growing on
the shores of Telluria. Cannot be eaten by itself.
name: Sugar

description:
A delicious cake! The apple and blueberry inside
compliment each other pefectly, surprisingly.
name: Fruitcake
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery, Buffs>

<Synthesis Ingredients>
Apple: 2
Blueberries: 3
Sugar: 3
Wheat: 3
Egg: 1
</Synthesis Ingredients>
<Mask Name: Fruity Dessert>

description:
A cluster of blueberries plucked from bushes
in the forests of Adon. Useful in cooking.
name: Blueberries

description:
An inconspicuous belt resonating with a mix of light
and dark power. Wearing it would certainly kill you.
name: The Warden's Belt

description:
A broken, beat-up, and useless helmet. Without the power
of soulfire, it has lost its colors and strong magic.
name: Forgotten General's Helmet

description:
A tiny pair of boots that once belonged to Henry. His shoe
size is so low that no one in the party can fit in these.
name: Henry's Tiny Boots

description:
A silver key that opens the right-most door Sam Payne's
basement. The door leads to the Haven Harbor Underground.
name: Sam's Key

description: A bottle of bitter medicine. Cures \it[39]\c[0].
name: Antidote

description:
A small journal detailing the intricacies
of elements. It was gifted to you by Mark.
name: Elemental Guide

description:
A book containing the Village Headman's
scribbled notes about classes and equipment.
name: Equipment Guide

description:
A small, tasty berry that grows in warm regions. Heals
a bit of HP and removes cold and wet status effects.
name: Heedup Berry
note:
<Menu Category: Recovery>
<Remove State Category: Ice>
<Remove State Category: Water>

description:
A peculiar book that allows an experienced
adventurer boost their intelligence.
name: INT Allocation Book

description:
A certificate granted to you for defeating
a rare variant of an enemy. Nice job!
name: Rare Enemy Certificate
